snippet: John A. Catsimatidis, the billionaire supermarket magnate, was identified as one of several contenders who could potentially beat a Democratic nominee.
abstract: New York City's five Republican county chairmen say they hope to identify a candidate to run for mayor on the Republican line, holding that the likely Democratic candidates are too liberal for the average New York voter. (M)/
lead_paragraph: Saying that the likely Democratic candidates for mayor are too liberal for the average New York voter, the city's five Republican county chairmen said Wednesday that they wanted to identify by the fall a candidate to run on the Republican line. In a news release, the five chairmen suggested that their first choice was John A. Catsimatidis, the billionaire supermarket magnate who considered running in 2009, before Mayor Michael R. Bloomberg had the law changed to run for a third term.

headline.main: Republican Leaders in City Seek Candidate for Mayor
